attributes.action: HM Queen to stop PM attempts to overrule parliamentary sovereignty in Council
attributes.additional_details: By constitutional convention, Parliament is sovereign in the United Kingdom government. When this is undermined by the overreaching actions of the executive, and the Monarch is invoked as an agent of undemocratic actions such as proroguing parliament to stifle democratic parliamentary debate, the Monarch should prefer the advice of parliament, when so instructed by the majority of parliament, in preference to votes in council when these two matters differ.
attributes.background: UK constitution demands parliament is sovereign. We urge Her Majesty the Queen to defend this fundamental principle. Any attempt by the executive to override parliamentary sovereignty is unconstitutional.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
	
You might like to sign this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/270776
